title: Ethiopia: Council Selects Country's 2015 World Best Tourist Destination
text:
Zimbabwe: National Gallery Needs U.S.$50 000 for Air-Con 
" Situations before 24 years were not conducive to tourism. This is due to the fact that the then government was not in the condition to respect diversity. This has an adverse effect for the sector." 
As to Amin, the existing stable political situation, the ever growing economy of the nation, presence of various tourist destinations, safety of tourists, infrastructural development and sector's contribution to the people were some of ECTT considerations to select Ethiopia. 
Ethiopian Tourism Organization CEO Solomon Tadesse on his part said that realizing the role of the tourism sector the government has given priority attention to its development. 
According to him, the recognition of ECTT as 2015 world's best tourist destination is a great opportunity to build the image of the country and add value on the tourism sector. 
State Minister of Culture and Tourism Mulugeta Seid also said that presence of various cultural practices and tourist destinations are playing a significant role in the tourism sector. Community based tourism in the country is also contributing to the development of tourism in the country, he added. 
On June 25, 2015 the General Assembly of the European Council on Tourism and Trade (ECTT) has taken under consideration the list of candidates for World Best Tourist Destination for 2015. 
On the debate for the World Best Tourist Destination Award for 2015, Council President Prof. Dr. Anton Caragea presented a report titled: Ethiopia : The perfect cultural destination; the land chosen by God! 
According to ECTT, tourism as a tool for poverty eradication, for local community development and for economic independence is a successful strategy carved by Prime Minister Hailemariam Desalegn. 
The report also indicated that community based, social oriented tourism, promoted by Prime Minister Hailemariam Dessalegn, is a perfect way of sharing revenue, growing income and supporting marginal and rural communities development. Ethiopia
